alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 14 at 1:14PM PST until January 15 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County and Western Imperial County. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Reduced visibilities in dust prone areas.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West
